answers.answer: Tell him if he wont induce you now that you are going to look for a diffrent DR. And do so if you need to. As long as the baby will be fine I dnt see why the wouldnt do it.
I'm a FTM, so I just assumed and trusted he'd do what's in the best interest of me and the baby. Thanks for the advice. I'll call them.
I would think he would schedule sooner. 39 weeks is a little late from my opinion. I would at least think he would say 37 weeks.

Wait till 37 weeks, then you are at least full term (before 37 weeks, babies are considered premature, and just not ready yet: there lungs aren't finished etc). But ask your doctor why he'd wait so long, perhaps he has a good reason? If not ask/demand for the c-section to be planned earlier. Btw, your baby can still come naturally before 39 weeks, maybe he waits to the max to give natural a chance?

Okay I'll wait until 37. Even if it happens naturally, he still says a c-section is evident because the baby will be too big to fit through me. I assumed he'd consider end of July also. I'll ask next week. Thanks for your info.

Unless absolutely necessary I would not have a section before 39 weeks and size of baby alone is not a medical reason no matter how "big" he or she is measuring.   Because a baby isn't being squeezed out the birth canal during a section, the baby can have a lot of fluid in the lungs and more breathing problems which can lead to a NICU stay. What are these measurements based on? Ultrasounds are highly inaccurate and final measurements can be off too. With mothers with diabetes, even if baby is measuring big lung function can be slow to develop so I would never ever schedule a c/s before 39 weeks. Not only that i think if you really have concerns you should probably seek an optniin from another dr and not a bunch of internet strangers in my honest opinion.
Good idea on not listening to advice from strangers, Ashleigh. I'll disregard yours completely

Hey honey sorry you are going though this.  But it's best to a least wait until 37 weeks and asked to get induced so that your beautiful baby is full term and lungs are working. Also baby size can be bigger or smaller from an ultrasound.I'm a Ftm so I'm just giving you information from my doctor Snice I'm here lol. I wish you best of luck.

Ok do that.  But I happen to be a L&D RN and have seen many babies go to NICU due to poor lung development with diabetes in pregnancy because the mom was either induced or had a c/s too early. But you know what if you want to be rude about it then I guess I will keep my actual medical knowledge and concern to myself next time and you can listen to the strangers instead of seeking a second OBs advice olejjm. Good luck

The babies lungs do not fully develop until 38 weeks and with diabites you shouldnt risk your babies health because your tired of being pregnant. The baby has a lot of growing and developing to do still in the last few weeks. Obviously your doctor knows what he/she is doing and wants your baby to be healthy. Listen to your doctor.
I never said I was tired of being pregnant. I said I didn't understand why he'd let me go so long with other complications.
Well wen some of us tried to explain why he was letting you go to 39 weeks you decided to not to listen to the reasons given by medical professionals
You're not a professional lol. And stop commenting on my post.

Believe what you want to. But I am a RN and I work in L&D. RNs are considered medical professionals.   Not only that, but I suggested getting a second option from a dr if you were really concerned/discouraged. The last time I checked its a public forum where you specifically asked for suggestions or experience, which as a RN I have so I commented which I am entitled to do.
Ashleigh is giving great advice and isnt being rude. I think the posters hormones are raging for her to be acting so rudely...

question: I know I've been complaining a lot now that I'm at the end of this pregnancy, but here's more. I'm 34 weeks and 4 days. Baby is measuring at 39 weeks. She's estimated to weight 8 pounds and 6 ounces. I have diabetes, and am now having high blood pressure due to so much stress I'm dealing with. I'm retaining a lot of water now. I've gained 7 pounds in one week. My complaint now: The Doctor said I definitely will need to have a c section because of the baby's size, but he said he won't schedule it until 39 weeks. I'm not sure why he would let the baby keep growing and getting so big that I can't even deliver naturally, but not schedule me sooner. Does anyone have any suggestions or similar experiences?
title: Very discouraged
